newsitem.title: USA: NBA BASKETBALL-NUGGETS OVERCOME 48 OLAJUWON POINTS TO BEAT THE ROCKETS.
newsitem.headline: NBA BASKETBALL-NUGGETS OVERCOME 48 OLAJUWON POINTS TO BEAT THE ROCKETS.

text.p: Ricky Pierce scored 25 points and LaPhonso Ellis had 11 of his 23 in the fourth quarter as the Denver Nuggets overcame 48 points by Hakeem Olajuwon for a 113-109 victory over the Houston Rockets on Thursday.
Dale Ellis had 20 points and Ervin Johnson grabbed 15 rebounds for Denver.
Olajuwon didn't attempt a free throw and made 24 field goals.

"I kept waiting for a foul and when I asked, they (the officials) said they would call one when they saw one," said Olajuwon, who made just one basket in the final 8:32. "I took good shots, but they rolled in and rolled out. That's basketball."

Olajuwon's 24 field goals without a free throw is believed to match an NBA all-time high established by Kareem Abdul-Jabbar of the Milwaukee Bucks on January 25th, 1973. Wilt Chamberlain and Alex English each made 22 field goals without a free throw.
In Dallas, Sam Mitchell scored 21 points and the Minnesota Timberwolves used a pair of 7-0 bursts two minutes apart and beat the Dallas Mavericks for the sixth straight time, 92-82.
Tom Gugliotta scored 17 points and Kevin Garnett added 15 for the Timberwolves, who won despite the absence of injured rookie point guard Stephon Marbury.
Chris Gatling had 29 points and 18 rebounds for Dallas.
In Los Angeles, Lov Vaught scored 20 of his 28 points in the second half as the Los Angeles Clippers sent the reeling Vancouver Grizzlies to their seventh consecutive loss, 100-94.
Vaught, who had 11 rebounds, recorded his 25th double double of the season for the Clippers. Darrick Martin added 13 and Malik Sealy had 12.
Bryant Reeves led Vancouver with 25 points.

At New Jersey, Kendall Gill scored 32 points and rookie Kerry Kittles scored half of his 20 points in the fourth quarter as the New Jersey Nets snapped a three-game losing streak with a 113-101 victory over the struggling Phoenix Suns.
Khalid Reeves, who had six three-pointers, added 25 points and nine assists.
Jayson Williams grabbed 20 rebounds for New Jersey.
In Sacramento, Michael Jordan scored nine of his 32 points in a game-ending surge as the Chicago Bulls won their fifth straight game, 111-93 over the Sacramento Kings.
Scottie Pippen added 22 points and Toni Kukoc contributed 16 for Chicago, which improved the league's best road record to 18-4.
Luc Longley grabbed 11 rebounds for the Bulls, and Jason Caffey and Randy Brown each scored 11 points for Chicago.
In Utah, Karl Malone scored 32 points and grabbed 15 rebounds to lead the Utah Jazz to their fifth straight victory, 102-96 over the Atlanta Hawks.
John Stockton added 16 points and 11 assists, and Greg Foster netted 13 points for Utah.
Steve Smith had 41 points and Mookie Blaylock 15 for Atlanta.
